metadata.Title: CVE-2019-15165 on Ubuntu 18.04 LTS (bionic) - medium.
metadata.Description:
sf-pcapng.c in libpcap before 1.9.1 does not properly validate the PHB header length before allocating memory.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2019-15165` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

libpcap0.8 - 1.8.1-6ubuntu1.18.04.1
No subscription required

notes.Note: sbeattie> this is likely actually fixed by 617b12c0339db4891d117b661982126c495439ea see github issue about CVE ID confusion but whatever, can't get a straight answer out of upstream, so will use this CVE ID for the issue that touches sf-pcapng.c

criterions.comment: libpcap package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1.8.1-6ubuntu1.18.04.1').
